tags.string: {Object|ZxQuery|Array<Node>|Node|NodeList|string|undefined} [element] Element or list of elements to include in the ZxQuery object.
tags.name: [element]
tags.description: Element or list of elements to include in the ZxQuery object.

tags.string: {ZxQuery} The *ZxQuery* object containing the given element(s).
tags.description: The *ZxQuery* object containing the given element(s).

description.full:
ZxQuery, a very lite subset of jQuery-like functions
internally used in Zuix for DOM operations.

The constructor takes one optional argument that can be
a DOM element, a node list or a valid DOM query selector string expression.
If no parameter is given, the resulting ZxQuery object will wrap the
root *document* element.
description.summary:
ZxQuery, a very lite subset of jQuery-like functions
internally used in Zuix for DOM operations.
description.body:
The constructor takes one optional argument that can be
a DOM element, a node list or a valid DOM query selector string expression.
If no parameter is given, the resulting ZxQuery object will wrap the
root *document* element.

code: function ZxQuery(element) {

description.full: Gets the number of elements in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary: Gets the number of elements in the ZxQuery object.

tags.string: {string} [filter] A valid DOM query selector filter (**default:** *first parent*).
tags.name: [filter]
tags.description: A valid DOM query selector filter (**default:** *first parent*).

tags.string: {ZxQuery} A new *ZxQuery* object containing the matching parent element.
tags.description: A new *ZxQuery* object containing the matching parent element.

description.full:
Gets the closest parent matching the given selector filter.
This only applies to the first element in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary:
Gets the closest parent matching the given selector filter.
This only applies to the first element in the ZxQuery object.

tags.string: {string} [filter] A valid DOM query selector filter (**default:** *all children*).
tags.name: [filter]
tags.description: A valid DOM query selector filter (**default:** *all children*).

tags.string: {ZxQuery}  A new *ZxQuery* object containing the selected *children*.
tags.description: A new *ZxQuery* object containing the selected *children*.

description.full:
Gets the children matching the given selector filter.
This only applies to the first element in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary:
Gets the children matching the given selector filter.
This only applies to the first element in the ZxQuery object.

description.full: Reverses order of the elements in the current set.
description.summary: Reverses order of the elements in the current set.

description.full:
Gets the DOM Element located at the given position in the ZxQuery object.
If no index is provided, the default element will be returned.
description.summary:
Gets the DOM Element located at the given position in the ZxQuery object.
If no index is provided, the default element will be returned.

tags.string: {ZxQuery} A new *ZxQuery* object containing the selected element.
tags.description: A new *ZxQuery* object containing the selected element.

description.full:
Gets a new ZxQuery object containing the element
located at the given position in the current ZxQuery object.
description.summary:
Gets a new ZxQuery object containing the element
located at the given position in the current ZxQuery object.

tags.string: {ZxQuery} A new *ZxQuery* object containing the selected elements.
tags.description: A new *ZxQuery* object containing the selected elements.

description.full:
Selects all descendants matching the given *DOM* query selector filter.
This only applies to the first element in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary:
Selects all descendants matching the given *DOM* query selector filter.
This only applies to the first element in the ZxQuery object.

tags.string: {ElementsIterationCallback} iterationCallback The callback function to call for each element in the ZxQuery object.
tags.name: iterationCallback
tags.description: The callback function to call for each element in the ZxQuery object.

description.full:
Iterates through all *DOM* elements in the selection.
The context object *this*, passed to the
*iterationCallback*`(index, item)` function, will be the
*DOM* element corresponding the current iteration.
`index` will be the iteration count, and `item`
the current Element. The function context `this` will be a
`{ZxQuery}` instance containing the current `item`.
To interrupt the iteration loop, return `false` in the callback
function or return `true` to continue to the next iteration.
description.summary:
Iterates through all *DOM* elements in the selection.
The context object *this*, passed to the
*iterationCallback*`(index, item)` function, will be the
*DOM* element corresponding the current iteration.
`index` will be the iteration count, and `item`
the current Element. The function context `this` will be a
`{ZxQuery}` instance containing the current `item`.
To interrupt the iteration loop, return `false` in the callback
function or return `true` to continue to the next iteration.

tags.string: {string|ZxQuery} The *attr* attribute value when no *val* specified, otherwise the *ZxQuery* object itself.
tags.description: The *attr* attribute value when no *val* specified, otherwise the *ZxQuery* object itself.

description.full:
Gets the value of an attribute for the first element in the ZxQuery object,
or sets one or more attributes for all elements in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary:
Gets the value of an attribute for the first element in the ZxQuery object,
or sets one or more attributes for all elements in the ZxQuery object.

tags.string: {string} eventPath Path of the event to trigger.
tags.name: eventPath
tags.description: Path of the event to trigger.

description.full: Triggers the given event for all elements in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary: Triggers the given event for all elements in the ZxQuery object.

description.full: Listens once to the given event for all elements in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary: Listens once to the given event for all elements in the ZxQuery object.

description.full: Listens to the given event for all elements in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary: Listens to the given event for all elements in the ZxQuery object.

description.full: Stops listening for the given event.
description.summary: Stops listening for the given event.

description.full: De-register all event handlers of all elements in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary: De-register all event handlers of all elements in the ZxQuery object.

tags.string: {boolean} *true* if the element is empty, *false* otherwise.
tags.description: *true* if the element is empty, *false* otherwise.

description.full: Returns *true* if the first element markup code is empty.
description.summary: Returns *true* if the first element markup code is empty.

description.full: Gets coordinates and visibility status of the first element.
description.summary: Gets coordinates and visibility status of the first element.

tags.name: prop
tags.description: The CSS property name or JSON list of property/value pairs.

tags.string: {string|ZxQuery} The CSS property value when no *val* specified, otherwise the *ZxQuery* object itself.
tags.description: The CSS property value when no *val* specified, otherwise the *ZxQuery* object itself.

description.full:
Gets the value of a CSS property for the first element in the ZxQuery object,
or sets one or more CSS property for all elements in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary:
Gets the value of a CSS property for the first element in the ZxQuery object,
or sets one or more CSS property for all elements in the ZxQuery object.

description.full: Adds the given CSS class to the class list of all elements in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary: Adds the given CSS class to the class list of all elements in the ZxQuery object.

tags.string: {boolean} *true* if the element contains the given CSS class, *false* otherwise.
tags.description: *true* if the element contains the given CSS class, *false* otherwise.

description.full: Returns *true* if the first element in the ZxQuery object contains the given CSS class.
description.summary: Returns *true* if the first element in the ZxQuery object contains the given CSS class.

description.full: Removes the given CSS class from all elements in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary: Removes the given CSS class from all elements in the ZxQuery object.

tags.string: {ZxQuery} A new *ZxQuery* object containing the previous sibling element.
tags.description: A new *ZxQuery* object containing the previous sibling element.

description.full:
Moves to the previous sibling in the DOM.
This only applies to the first element in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary:
Moves to the previous sibling in the DOM.
This only applies to the first element in the ZxQuery object.

tags.string: {ZxQuery} A new *ZxQuery* object containing the next sibling element.
tags.description: A new *ZxQuery* object containing the next sibling element.

description.full:
Moves to the next sibling in the DOM.
This only applies to the first element in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary:
Moves to the next sibling in the DOM.
This only applies to the first element in the ZxQuery object.

description.full:
Gets the HTML string of the first element in the ZxQuery object,
or sets the HTML string for all elements in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary:
Gets the HTML string of the first element in the ZxQuery object,
or sets the HTML string for all elements in the ZxQuery object.

tags.name: [check]
tags.description: Value to assign to the 'checked' attribute.

description.full:
Gets the `checked` attribute of the first element in the ZxQuery object,
or sets the `checked` attribute value for all elements in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary:
Gets the `checked` attribute of the first element in the ZxQuery object,
or sets the `checked` attribute value for all elements in the ZxQuery object.

Gets the `value` attribute of the first element in the ZxQuery object,

description.summary:

description.summary: Appends the given element or HTML string to the first element in the ZxQuery object.

Inserts the given child element before the one located at the specified index
to the first element in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary:
Inserts the given child element before the one located at the specified index
to the first element in the ZxQuery object.

description.full: Prepends the given element or HTML string to the first element in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary: Prepends the given element or HTML string to the first element in the ZxQuery object.

description.full: Detach from its parent the first element in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary: Detach from its parent the first element in the ZxQuery object.

description.full: Re-attach to its parent the first element in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary: Re-attach to its parent the first element in the ZxQuery object.

tags.description: The *display* value when no *mode* specified, otherwise the *ZxQuery* object itself.

Gets the CSS `display` property of the first element in the ZxQuery object,
or sets the `display` property value for all elements in the ZxQuery object.
description.summary:
Gets the CSS `display` property of the first element in the ZxQuery object,
or sets the `display` property value for all elements in the ZxQuery object.

description.summary:

tags.string: {string} [mode] Set the display mode to be used to show element (eg. block, inline, etc..).
tags.name: [mode]
tags.description: Set the display mode to be used to show element (eg. block, inline, etc..).

description.full: Sets the CSS `display` property to '' if no argument value is provided, otherwise set it to the given value.
description.summary: Sets the CSS `display` property to '' if no argument value is provided, otherwise set it to the given value.

description.full: Sets the CSS `display` property to 'none'.
description.summary: Sets the CSS `display` property to 'none'.

description.full: Creates a ZxQuery wrapped element.

description.full: Selects document elements matching the given *DOM* query selector.
description.summary: Selects document elements matching the given *DOM* query selector.

tags.string: {IterationCallback} iterationCallback The callback *fn* to call at each iteration
tags.name: iterationCallback
tags.description: The callback *fn* to call at each iteration

description.full:
Iterate through all objects in the given `items` collection.
The context object *this*, passed to the
*iterationCallback*`(index, item)`, will be the
object corresponding the current iteration and
the `index` passed to the callback will be the iteration count.

If the callback returns *false*, the iteration loop will interrupt.
description.summary:
Iterate through all objects in the given `items` collection.
The context object *this*, passed to the
*iterationCallback*`(index, item)`, will be the
object corresponding the current iteration and
the `index` passed to the callback will be the iteration count.
description.body: If the callback returns *false*, the iteration loop will interrupt.

description.summary: Checks if an element has got the specified CSS class.

description.summary: Checks if a class exists by searching for it in all document stylesheets.

description.summary: Wraps an {Element} inside a container specified by a given tag name.

tags.description: id to assign to the stylesheet

tags.description: The new style element created out of the given css text.

description.full: Appends or replaces a stylesheet to the document.
description.summary: Appends or replaces a stylesheet to the document.

tags.string: {object} model Object containing variables fields and values.
tags.name: model
tags.description: Object containing variables fields and values.

tags.string: {string} The new stylesheet text with variables replaced with values
tags.description: The new stylesheet text with variables replaced with values

description.full: Replaces CSS variables with provided values.
description.summary: Replaces CSS variables with provided values.

tags.string: {function} callback A callback function with one argument (the currently parsed variable name).
tags.name: callback
tags.description: A callback function with one argument (the currently parsed variable name).

tags.string: {string|null} The new html code with variables replaced with values or null if no variable was replaced.
tags.description: The new html code with variables replaced with values or null if no variable was replaced.

description.full:
Parses variables enclosed in single or double braces and calls the given callback for each parsed variable name.
If the callback returns a value, then the variable will be replaced with the given value.
description.summary:
Parses variables enclosed in single or double braces and calls the given callback for each parsed variable name.
If the callback returns a value, then the variable will be replaced with the given value.
